boat.full_description: ON 689 is The Manchester & Salford. She was built in 1924 by SE Saunders IoW as a sailing lifeboat for the RNLI. From 1924 to 1946, she was the Douglas lifeboat on the Isle of Man and then in relief service in many other place until 1956. She has a gaff main + mizzen mast and an early petrol engine and also a drop keel to enhance her sailing capability.
boat.name: The Manchester & Salford
boat.short_description: A classic GL Watson sailing lifeboat with gaff main and mizzen totally rebuilt over 20 years to new condition.
